body: LEAD: New York State's environmental commissioner declined yesterday to grant a permit for the enormous garbage incinerator proposed at the old Brooklyn Navy Yard. title: Albany Denies Permission For Navy Yard Incinerator

body: LEAD: A SALESWOMAN hovers in the doorway of Volity Narayan Prakash's office in his jewelry store in Jackson Heights, Queens. She has a problem. A customer is buying a $2,400 gold chain for cash, but he is $100 short. Mr. Prakash strides out to the counter and speaks to his customer in the south Indian dialect he learned as a child in Bangalore. A
title: THE ULTIMATE MARKETPLACE; Tales of Success

title: Don't Dismiss the Dangers of Incinerator Ash; View From Brooklyn

title: Don't Dismiss the Dangers of Incinerator Ash

body: LEAD: Vowing to fight any effort by New York State to close the Fresh Kills landfill on Staten Island, Mayor Edward I. Koch yesterday denounced the state's environmental chief as the ''Colossus in Albany,'' a ''hanging judge'' and ''zealot'' whose tactics were ''insane'' and ''most vicious.'' Vowing to fight any effort by New York State to close
title: Irate Koch Jabs At State Threat To Shut Landfill

body: LEAD: New York State's top environmental official filed a civil complaint against New York City today accusing it of ignoring his orders to clean up its huge Fresh Kills Landfill on Staten Island. He is seeking $76 million in fines. The official, Thomas C. Jorling, the Environmental Conservation Commissioner, also threatened to obtain a court order
title: New York State Seeks $76 Million In Fines Over Fresh Kills Landfill

title: THE 1989 ELECTIONS: Governor-Elect MAN IN THE NEWS: James Joseph Florio; Careful and Determined

title: No Way to Meet the Garbage Crisis

body: LEAD: President Bush said today that he would nominate Richard C. Breeden, his troubleshooter in the savings and loan crisis, as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. body: LEAD: The tanker that spilled 420,000 gallons of heating oil into the ocean off Rhode Island arrived yesterday evening at a Brooklyn shipyard for repairs, the Coast Guard said. The vessel, the World Prodigy, arrived at the New York Shipyard Corporation at the site of the old Brooklyn Navy Yard at about 7:30 P.M., said Petty Officer Kevin Moisan.
title: Oil Tanker Arrives for Repairs
